com.intel.jndn.utils.client.impl

Class DefaultStreamingClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.jndn.utils.client.impl.DefaultStreamingClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StreamingClient

    public class DefaultStreamingClient
extends Object
implements StreamingClient
    Default implementation of StreamingClient; uses a segmented client to retrieve packets asynchronously and pipes them to a stream as they are received.
    Author:
    Andrew Brown

      • getStreamAsync

        public InputStream getStreamAsync(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                                  net.named_data.jndn.Interest interest,
                                  SegmentationType partitionMarker)
                           throws IOException
        Asynchronously request a packet over the network and retrieve the partitioned content bytes as an input stream
        Specified by:
        getStreamAsync in interface StreamingClient
        Parameters:
        face - the Face on which to make the request; call Face.processEvents() separately to complete the request
        interest - the Interest to send over the network
        partitionMarker - the byte marker identifying how the data packets are partitioned (e.g. segmentation, see http://named-data.net/doc/tech-memos/naming-conventions.pdf)
        Returns:
        a stream of content bytes
        Throws:
        IOException - if the stream setup fails
